physicalDescription.note: On envelope: "#1092 JCRS Patients and Nurses c. 1920" On back of photograph: "Sarah Nordstrom Anderson (my mother) 3rd nurse from left, some of our gang at our building where we had rooms, #1092."

mods.abstract: Eleven nurses in uniform stand in front of the Lena Bloch Memorial Home for Nurses. Sarah Nordstrom Anderson stands third from the left. The JCRS was a sanatorium for tuberculosis patients that was founded in 1904 by a group of immigrant Jewish workingmen along with the support of several leading physicians and rabbis in Denver, Colorado. It was located on West Colfax Avenue just outside Denver.
